author: Rick Coleman
title: Janesville Runs Over Clarksville
text:
Janesville Runs Over Clarksville - KWWL - Eastern Iowa Breaking News, Weather, Closings Member Center: Friday Night Heroes Catch all the high school football highlights during the regular season and playoffs, get live score updates and vote for the Play of the Week and the Game of the Week! More >> Catch all the high school football highlights during the regular season and playoffs, get live score updates and vote for the Play of the Week and the Game of the Week! More >> More >> 
High scoring Janesville averaging 53 points a game meets a Clarksville team that is allowing 71 points a game. This means the scoreboard operator might be busy and he certainly was. 
Jack Thode and fellow Senior Noah Dodd connects eight plays into the game from the Clarksville 20 yard line. Dodd finds Thode out in the flat and Thode puts on the jets from the 16-yard line and finds his way into the back of the endzone. Wildcats 7-zip with three minutes in. 
Six plays later Clarksville would take it's only lead of the game...Quarterback, number three Zach Sommerfelt, fakes the handoff and keeps it himself from the 6 yardline and bullies his way into the endzone. The Indians convert on the two point conversion to make it 8 to 7 Clarksville. 
It would only take three plays for the Wildcats to retake the lead....14-8 with Kevin Hahn taking it up the middle for the touchdown from a yard out. 
Fast forward three minutes...the game now tied 14-all. The Indians kick off after scoring and Nick Nelson recieves it from the Janesville five and he finds a hole off the right side and would not get touched running 75 yards to the house...touchdown Wildcats, extra point good, 21-14 Janesville. 
Two and a half minutes later, first and ten from the eight yard line and Dodd finds Josiah Hovenga deep...for a 71 yard catch and run for the touchdown...28-14 at the end of the first quarter. The Wildcats run away from Clarksville in week eight of Friday Night Heroes....87 to 20. Can't Find Something? 500 Fourth St. Waterloo, IA 50703 News: (319) 291-1200
